description: Peter seated at center with shackles on his wrists and ankles broken, with arms held open, PR arm raised and PL arm down with hand near his PL thigh; Peter has curly hair and beard; angel at right touches Peter on shoulder and holds PL arm toward open doorway at right with view of buildings; two sleeping soldiers in foreground--figure on left holds his head in his PL hand, figure on right wears helmet and leans on his shield
inscription:
Inscription

on back of mount, in pencil: [Patricio Cajés or Caxés (Areggo ca 1540 - Madrid 1612) / Peter in Prison / by Parmegiano], [890], [S] and [20180396/8/134]
medium: Black chalk with pen and brown ink and brown wash on paper
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 8, 1998, no.130 as North Italian, early 17th century, for £1,074.50, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1998-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Liberation of Saint Peter
